intro: Erodium macradenum var. navasii, commonly known as Navas' bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern California. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland areas. It is an annual herb that thrives in full sun and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
